headline: Business Development Representative
summary: From assisting in research projects at McGill’s teaching hospital – most notable the Lady Davis Institute – to Concordia University and École Polytechnique de Montreal, my research interests have grazed breast cancer and malaria. Two-time gold medalist at the Bell Montreal Regional Science Fair. Ranked as Top Three Finalist for Forces Avenir Quebec’s Colleges in the category of Science and Technology. Recipient of  McGill University Parasitology Award and McGill University Faculty of Science Award on different counts. Volunteer Judge at the Expo-Science Montreal Regional Science and Technology Fair for projects competing in Biotechnology and Health Science related categories.As an undergraduate in Pharmacology, President of my graduating class and Vice President of Communication in the Pharmacology Student Association, I am devoted to have a social-academic impact on my peers. Amongst the strives to be an active member of the student association, I also founded an organization by the name 20XX Imperium. 20XX Imperium stands for the female empire of the 21st century. My organization aspires to inspire women from different academic backgrounds across the world to venture for executive positions in the work force, despite the gender parity gap in the cooperate ladder. 20XX Imperium uses a social media platform to promote, expose and highlight women’s past achievement and future goals. If you wish to contact me, send a brief message to amanda.f.lopez@usherbrooke.ca.
